title: Isolate the Quadratic Term
text: We minus $$5$$ on both sides to get $$u^2$$ by itself which gives $$\frac{2}{3} u^2=12$$.

title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"

title: Use Square root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $$u^2=18$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$u=\sqrt{18}$$ or $$u=-\sqrt{18}$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$\frac{2}{3} u^2$$ $$+5=17$$ has two solutions which are $$u=-3\sqrt{2}$$ $$andu=3\sqrt{2}$$.
